metadata.disclaimer: Based on publicly available crosswalks and expert analysis. Validate with qualified assessors for compliance/audit use.

clauses.title: Inventory and Control of Enterprise Assets
clauses.rationale: CM-8 directly covers component inventory with automated discovery and tracking enhancements. PM-5 system inventory. Comprehensive asset management.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. CIS 1 includes active/passive asset discovery; CM-8 enhancements cover this.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain Detailed Enterprise Asset Inventory
clauses.rationale: CM-8 directly requires system component inventory with detail.

clauses.title: Address Unauthorized Assets
clauses.rationale: CM-8(3) covers automated unauthorized component detection.

clauses.title: Utilize DHCP Logging to Update Enterprise Asset Inventory
clauses.rationale: AU-3 audit record content; CM-8(1) updates during various events. DHCP logging specific implementation not prescribed.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 doesn't specifically address DHCP logging for inventory. General audit and inventory controls apply.

clauses.title: Use Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) Logging
clauses.rationale: AU-3 audit content; SI-4 system monitoring. DHCP-specific logging not explicitly addressed.
clauses.gaps: DHCP logging is a specific implementation technique not called out in SP 800-53.

clauses.title: Use a Passive Asset Discovery Tool
clauses.rationale: CM-8(1) updates during events; CM-8(2) automated maintenance. Passive discovery concept covered by automated inventory mechanisms.
clauses.gaps: Specific passive discovery tooling not prescribed; general automated inventory mechanisms cover the intent.

clauses.title: Inventory and Control of Software Assets
clauses.rationale: CM-7 least functionality; CM-8 component inventory (includes software); CM-10 software usage restrictions; CM-11 user-installed software; SA-22 unsupported components.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Software Inventory
clauses.rationale: CM-8 component inventory includes software; CM-10 software usage restrictions require inventory.

clauses.title: Ensure Authorized Software is Currently Supported
clauses.rationale: SA-22 directly addresses unsupported system components.

clauses.title: Address Unauthorized Software
clauses.rationale: CM-7 least functionality (application whitelisting); CM-11 user-installed software restrictions.

clauses.title: Allowlist Authorized Software
clauses.rationale: CM-7(4) and CM-7(5) directly address application whitelisting/allowlisting.

clauses.title: Allowlist Authorized Libraries
clauses.rationale: CM-7 application allowlisting; SA-10 developer configuration management.
clauses.gaps: CIS specifically addresses library-level allowlisting. SP 800-53 allowlisting is at application level; library-specific control less explicit.

clauses.title: Allowlist Authorized Scripts
clauses.rationale: CM-7(4)/(5) application allowlisting covers scripts conceptually.
clauses.gaps: Script-specific allowlisting is a subset of application allowlisting. CM-7 enhancements cover the intent.

clauses.title: Data Protection
clauses.rationale: SC-28 data at rest; SC-8 data in transit; MP family media protection; AC-4 information flow; RA-2 data classification; PT family privacy.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS 3 includes specific data management processes (inventory, disposal, flow diagrams). SP 800-53 covers protection mechanisms but data management lifecycle is distributed.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Data Management Process
clauses.rationale: SI-12 information management; PM-1 security program includes data management.
clauses.gaps: CIS requires specific data management process documentation. SP 800-53 addresses through various controls but no unified data management process control.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Data Inventory
clauses.rationale: RA-2 security categorization requires data identification; CM-8 component inventory; PM-5 system inventory.
clauses.gaps: CIS specifically requires data inventory. SP 800-53 categorizes data but doesn't require explicit data inventory/catalog.

clauses.title: Configure Data Access Control Lists
clauses.rationale: AC-3 access enforcement; AC-6 least privilege. Direct mapping.

clauses.title: Enforce Data Retention
clauses.rationale: SI-12 information lifecycle; AU-11 audit record retention.
clauses.gaps: CIS covers data retention broadly. SP 800-53 addresses retention for specific data types.

clauses.title: Encrypt Sensitive Data in Transit
clauses.rationale: SC-8 transmission confidentiality/integrity; SC-8(1) cryptographic protection. Direct mapping.

clauses.title: Encrypt Sensitive Data at Rest
clauses.rationale: SC-28 protection of information at rest; SC-28(1) cryptographic protection. Direct mapping.

clauses.title: Secure Configuration of Enterprise Assets and Software
clauses.rationale: CM-2 baseline configuration; CM-6 configuration settings; CM-7 least functionality; CM-3 change control. Comprehensive configuration management.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Secure Configuration Process
clauses.rationale: CM-1 configuration management policy; CM-2 baseline; CM-6 settings. Direct mapping.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Secure Configuration Process for Network Infrastructure
clauses.rationale: CM-6 configuration settings; SC-7 boundary protection configuration.

clauses.title: Manage Default Accounts on Enterprise Assets
clauses.rationale: AC-2 account management; CM-6 configuration settings (disable defaults); IA-5 authenticator management.

clauses.title: Account Management
clauses.rationale: AC-2 comprehensive account management; AC-5 separation of duties; AC-6 least privilege; IA-4 identifier management; IA-5 authenticator management.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. SP 800-53 AC/IA families are comprehensive for account management.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain an Inventory of Accounts
clauses.rationale: AC-2 directly requires account inventory and management.

clauses.title: Use Unique Passwords
clauses.rationale: IA-5 authenticator management; IA-5(1) password-based authentication. Direct mapping.

clauses.title: Disable Dormant Accounts
clauses.rationale: AC-2(3) directly covers disabling inactive accounts.

clauses.title: Restrict Administrator Privileges to Dedicated Administrator Accounts
clauses.rationale: AC-6(5) privileged accounts. Direct mapping.

clauses.title: Access Control Management
clauses.rationale: AC family comprehensively covers access control management.

clauses.title: Establish an Access Granting Process
clauses.rationale: AC-2 account management includes granting; AC-6 least privilege.

clauses.title: Establish an Access Revoking Process
clauses.rationale: AC-2 account deprovisioning; PS-4 termination; PS-5 transfer.

clauses.title: Require MFA for Externally-Exposed Applications
clauses.rationale: IA-2(1)/(2) multi-factor authentication for privileged and non-privileged accounts.

clauses.title: Require MFA for Remote Network Access
clauses.rationale: AC-17 remote access with MFA; IA-2(1) multi-factor for privileged.

clauses.title: Require MFA for Administrative Access
clauses.rationale: IA-2(1) directly requires MFA for privileged accounts.

clauses.title: Continuous Vulnerability Management
clauses.rationale: RA-5 vulnerability monitoring/scanning; SI-2 flaw remediation; SI-5 security alerts; CA-7 continuous monitoring. Comprehensive vulnerability management.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Vulnerability Management Process
clauses.rationale: RA-5 directly establishes vulnerability management process.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Remediation Process
clauses.rationale: SI-2 flaw remediation; CA-5 POA&M for tracking remediation.

clauses.title: Perform Automated Application Patch Management
clauses.rationale: SI-2 flaw remediation with automated patching enhancements.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS specifically addresses application-level patching automation.

clauses.title: Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Internal Enterprise Assets
clauses.rationale: RA-5 with automated scanning enhancements.

clauses.title: Remediate Detected Vulnerabilities
clauses.rationale: SI-2 flaw remediation; CA-5 plan of action; RA-5 vulnerability response.

clauses.title: Audit Log Management
clauses.rationale: AU family comprehensively covers audit logging: events (AU-2), content (AU-3), capacity (AU-4), response (AU-5), review (AU-6), generation (AU-12).

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain an Audit Log Management Process
clauses.rationale: AU-1 audit policy; AU-2 event logging definition.

clauses.title: Collect Audit Logs
clauses.rationale: AU-2 auditable events; AU-3 content; AU-12 audit record generation.

clauses.title: Collect Detailed Audit Logs
clauses.rationale: AU-3 audit record content with additional information enhancement.

clauses.title: Centralize Audit Logs
clauses.rationale: AU-6(4) central review and analysis; SI-4(2) automated real-time analysis tools.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. Log centralization is implied by central review/analysis controls.

clauses.title: Conduct Audit Log Reviews
clauses.rationale: AU-6 audit review, analysis, and reporting with process integration.

clauses.title: Email and Web Browser Protections
clauses.rationale: SC-7 boundary protection; SI-3 malware protection; SI-8 spam protection; SC-18 mobile code.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 covers email/web security through general controls. CIS 9 is more prescriptive about specific email and browser hardening configurations.

clauses.title: Ensure Use of Only Fully Supported Browsers and Email Clients
clauses.rationale: SA-22 unsupported components; CM-7 least functionality.
clauses.gaps: CIS is specific about browser/email client support. SP 800-53 addresses through general component support controls.

clauses.title: Use DNS Filtering Services
clauses.rationale: SC-7 boundary protection; SC-20/SC-21 DNS security.
clauses.gaps: CIS specifically addresses DNS filtering for malicious domains. SP 800-53 DNS controls focus on integrity (DNSSEC) rather than content filtering.

clauses.title: Malware Defenses
clauses.rationale: SI-3 malicious code protection with comprehensive enhancements; SI-4 monitoring; SI-8 spam protection.

clauses.title: Deploy and Maintain Anti-Malware Software
clauses.rationale: SI-3 directly covers anti-malware deployment and maintenance.

clauses.title: Configure Automatic Anti-Malware Signature Updates
clauses.rationale: SI-3(2) covers automatic updates.

clauses.title: Configure Automatic Anti-Malware Scanning of Removable Media
clauses.rationale: SI-3(1) central management of anti-malware; MP-7 media use. Removable media scanning covered.

clauses.title: Use Behavior-Based Anti-Malware Software
clauses.rationale: SI-3 malware protection; SI-4(4) inbound/outbound analysis.
clauses.gaps: CIS specifically addresses behavior-based detection. SP 800-53 covers through general malware and monitoring controls.

clauses.title: Data Recovery
clauses.rationale: CP-9 system backup; CP-6 alternate storage; CP-10 system recovery. Comprehensive data recovery.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Data Recovery Process
clauses.rationale: CP-9 backup; CP-2 contingency plan including recovery procedures.

clauses.title: Perform Automated Backups
clauses.rationale: CP-9 backup with testing restoration enhancement.

clauses.title: Protect Recovery Data
clauses.rationale: CP-9 backup protection; CP-6 alternate storage site.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain an Isolated Instance of Recovery Data
clauses.rationale: CP-6 alternate storage site; CP-9 backup. Air-gapped/isolated backup concept supported.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS specifically addresses isolated recovery data. CP-6 covers alternate storage but isolation level less explicit.

clauses.title: Network Infrastructure Management
clauses.rationale: SC-7 boundary protection; CM-2 network baselines; CM-6 network settings; CM-7 least functionality; AC-4 information flow.

clauses.title: Ensure Network Infrastructure is Up-to-Date
clauses.rationale: SA-22 unsupported components; SI-2 flaw remediation; CM-6 configuration settings.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS specifically addresses network device firmware/software currency. SP 800-53 addresses through general patching/support controls.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Secure Network Architecture
clauses.rationale: PL-8 security architecture; SC-7 boundary protection; SC-32 system partitioning.

clauses.title: Network Monitoring and Defense
clauses.rationale: SI-4 system monitoring; AU-6 audit review; SC-7 boundary protection; IR-4 incident handling; CA-7 continuous monitoring.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. SP 800-53 monitoring and defense controls are comprehensive.

clauses.title: Centralize Security Event Alerting
clauses.rationale: SI-4(5) system-generated alerts; AU-6(4) central review. Centralized alerting well covered.

clauses.title: Deploy a Network Intrusion Detection Solution
clauses.rationale: SI-4 system monitoring includes NIDS; SC-7(6) response to recognized failures.

clauses.title: Collect Network Traffic Flow Logs
clauses.rationale: AU-3 audit content; SI-4(4) inbound/outbound communications traffic analysis.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS specifically addresses network flow data. SP 800-53 covers through general monitoring.

clauses.title: Deploy a Network Intrusion Prevention Solution
clauses.rationale: SC-7 boundary protection with traffic filtering; SI-4(4) traffic analysis.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS specifically addresses inline prevention. SP 800-53 covers through general boundary and monitoring controls.

clauses.title: Security Awareness and Skills Training
clauses.rationale: AT family comprehensive: AT-1 policy; AT-2 awareness; AT-3 role-based training; AT-4 records; PM-13 workforce; PM-14 testing.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Security Awareness Program
clauses.rationale: AT-1/AT-2 awareness program; PM-13 workforce development.

clauses.title: Train Workforce Members to Recognize Social Engineering Attacks
clauses.rationale: AT-2(2) practical exercises including social engineering awareness.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. SP 800-53 Rev 5 explicitly includes social engineering training.

clauses.title: Train Workforce on Data Handling Best Practices
clauses.rationale: AT-2/AT-3 training includes data handling; MP-1 media protection policy.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS is specific about data handling training. SP 800-53 includes through general training.

clauses.title: Service Provider Management
clauses.rationale: SA-4 acquisition; SA-9 external services; SR family supply chain. Comprehensive service provider security management.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS 15 includes specific guidance on classifying service providers and monitoring. SP 800-53 covers through acquisition and supply chain controls.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain an Inventory of Service Providers
clauses.rationale: SA-9 external services require identification; PM-5 system inventory.
clauses.gaps: CIS specifically requires service provider inventory. SP 800-53 implies but doesn't explicitly mandate a service provider register.

clauses.title: Application Software Security
clauses.rationale: SA family comprehensive for application security: SDLC (SA-3), requirements (SA-4), engineering (SA-8), config management (SA-10), testing (SA-11), standards (SA-15).

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Secure Application Development Process
clauses.rationale: SA-3 SDLC; SA-15 development process and standards.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Process to Accept and Address Software Vulnerabilities
clauses.rationale: SI-2 flaw remediation; RA-5 vulnerability management; SA-11 developer testing.

clauses.title: Use Hardened Images
clauses.rationale: CM-2 baseline configuration; CM-6 configuration settings. Hardened image concept covered through baselines.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS specifically addresses golden/hardened images. SP 800-53 uses baseline concept which is similar.

clauses.title: Implement Code-Level Security Checks
clauses.rationale: SA-11(1) static code analysis; SA-11(2) dynamic code analysis.

clauses.title: Incident Response Management
clauses.rationale: IR family comprehensively covers incident response management.

clauses.title: Designate Personnel to Manage Incident Handling
clauses.rationale: IR-1/IR-2 roles and training; PM-2 security role assignment.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain an Incident Response Process
clauses.rationale: IR-8 incident response plan; IR-1 incident response policy.

clauses.title: Define Mechanisms for Communicating During Incident Response
clauses.rationale: IR-4 incident handling; IR-6 reporting; IR-7 assistance.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. Communication mechanisms covered through IR family.

clauses.title: Conduct Post-Incident Reviews
clauses.rationale: IR-3 incident response testing/lessons learned; IR-4 incident handling includes post-incident activities.

clauses.title: Penetration Testing
clauses.rationale: CA-8 directly covers penetration testing. CA-8(1) independent penetration agent. RA-5 vulnerability assessment.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Penetration Testing Program
clauses.rationale: CA-8 directly establishes penetration testing requirements.

clauses.title: Remediate Penetration Test Findings
clauses.rationale: CA-5 POA&M for remediation tracking; SI-2 flaw remediation.

clauses.title: Perform Periodic External Penetration Tests
clauses.rationale: CA-8 covers penetration testing. External perspective specified through scope.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS specifically addresses external penetration testing cadence. CA-8 covers testing generally.
